text: Hidasnémeti is a village in Gönc District in Borsod-Abaúj-Zemplén County, Hungary. In 2024, 1,000 people lived there. == Location == It is in the Hernád Valley, on the right side of the river, near the Slovak border, about 60 kilometers northeast of Miskolc. == History == The village was likely started in the 12th century by German settlers along with nine other nearby villages. == Population == In 2022, 81.4% of the population identified as Hungarian, 20.3% as Slovak, 17.1% as Roma, 0.2% as German, 0.1% as Rusyn, and 1.3% as other non-native nationalities (5% did not respond; due to dual identities, the total may exceed 100%). According to their religion, 36.6% were Roman Catholic, 17% Reformed, 4.3% Greek Catholic, 0.7% other Christian, 1% Lutheran, 13% non-denominational (26.6% did not respond). == Sport == The village sports club, HVSC (Hidasnémeti Vasutas Sport Club), was founded in 1949. The sports club now (2025) has four sections: men's football, chess, volleyball, and wrestling. == Notes == Category:Villages in Hungary Category:Settlements in Borsod-Abaúj-Zemplén County Category:Gönc District
title: Hidasnémeti
